title: Can multiple people use the same Apple ID? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can they? Yes. Should they? Definitely not! Your contacts, photos, text messages, FaceTime calls, and anything else that uses iCloud will be all jumbled together. It’s a huge mess that you’ll go to the Apple Store or call Apple Support for help. There you will find that they data cannot be easily untangled. You’ll need to set up a second Apple ID and manually transfer phone numbers, photos, etc. from one Apple ID to the other. It’s a whole lot easier to start out with separate IDs. If your worried about a child having their own ID, Apple’s got you covered: Use parental controls on your child's iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch

Yes, of course. An Apple ID can support an infinite number of iPhone devices, but a PC terminal license can only support up to 5. For many people sharing an Apple ID, keep it private. Also, remember to turn off iCloud function that you don’t use.
